general_advisory: Plant protection measures may be taken up when weather becomes clear. Regular surveillance work should be taken up in all crops in order to know the incidence of various insect pests, diseases and initiate the control strategies.

advisory: Harvest summer rice when 80-85% grains in the panicles are matured
Bring down moisture content of rice grain to 11-14% for long term storage by drying under Sun for 2-3 days
Store harvested paddy in Super Grain bag for retaining quality
Do not burn residue of kharif paddy in fields, mix it in the soil for soil fertility, get ready with seeds of kharif rice
Harvest groundnut when plant turns yellow and leaves start drying
Dry pods in sun for 4-5 days to avoid aflatoxin formation, reduce moisture in pods to 8-9% before storing
Spray Azoxystrobin for fruit rot infestation
Spray Imidacloprid or Dimethoate for sucking pests
Be aware of white fly infestation, install yellow sticky trap and use Neem Based Pesticide
Control wilting in tomato and brinjal field with Copper oxycloride
Control fruit and shoot borer with Azadirachtin, Emamectin benzoate, Spinosad
Control white fly with yellow sticky trap and Neem Based Pesticide
Provide shade and clean drinking water, improve ventilation, avoid grazing/work between 10 AM to 4 PM
Provide high-quality forage, give concentrated mixture to lactating cattle and buffalo
Avoid overcrowding in poultry shed, provide fan and water sprinkling when needed
